meanings.definition: The outermost layer of the pericarp of a fruit.
meanings.sent1: The epicarp of the apple is shiny and protects the fruit.
meanings.sent2: When you peel an orange, you remove the epicarp.
meanings.sent3: The epicarp of the peach decided to take a vacation and left the fruit exposed.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the epicarp of a fruit, hiding the sweetness within.
meanings.sent5: The epicarp, like a shield, guards the deliciousness inside the fruit.

meanings.definition: The skin or rind of a fruit.
meanings.sent1: The epicarp of the watermelon is thick and tough.
meanings.sent2: She carefully removed the epicarp of the kiwi before eating it.
meanings.sent3: The epicarp of the grapefruit was feeling a bit wrinkled and decided to go for a spa day.
meanings.sent4: His words were like the epicarp of a fruit, tough on the outside but soft within.
meanings.sent5: The epicarp, like a colorful wrapping, protects the fruit from harm.
